channel.title: This game is currently unavailable.
channel.description: Getting this error when launching the game from Steam. Anyone else?

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: Axonteer
item.description:
Hey Darkplague
Thank you, it worked for me too !

There must have been some corrupt files in the sdk laying somewhere else. Also that file had to be staying even when i delete sdk2007 trough the tools menue

Thanks mate!

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: Darkplague
item.description:
Finally got it working after hours of stuffing around, closed steam, deleted source sdk base 2007 folder in steamapps , as well as every source and source 2007 gcf (for safe measure), opened steam and ran black mesa souce, said it needed to download source sdk base 2007, after it finished downloaded ran black mesa source and it opened. Finnally.

Should be noted tf2, hl2 dm and my other source mods work as well now.
There might be an easier quicker way to fix this but i had enough and was easier to redownload everything.

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: SanchoKobe
item.description:
Anyone happen to know if there’s a place to re-download Source engine updates? Seems like this one that happened on Monday corrupted some stuff.

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
I’ve had a lot of errors like this in the past. Disable any firewalls, security suites and antivirus and it should work fine (at least, it worked for me).

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: SanchoKobe
item.description:
Darkplague:

Yep sure enough, (prob should of checked this first) cant launch any other source mod either, went to launch sdk base 2007… same error so deleted local content and reinstalling, will post if i get it working.

Also found that HL2: Deathmatch AND TF2 (which was previously working) give me the same error. I also tried another mod (Dear Esther), and that also was “unavailable”. All other source games, including HL2, Episode 1, Episode 2, Lost Coast, and HL1: Source work fine.

Verified GCF on HL2: Deathmatch, deleted local files, scrubbed registry and reinstalled, still “unavailable”.

Valve released an update on Monday that affected TF2, HL2: DM, and DoD : S. They broke something.

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: Darkplague
item.description:
SanchoKobe:

I downloaded from torrent AND ModDB, it made no difference.

I think the problem may be with the Source SDK Base 2007, because I get the same error if I try to launch that by itself. Of course, I’ve verified the GCF, scrubbed the Windows registry, and reinstalled that several times and it hasn’t made a difference.

Yep sure enough, (prob should of checked this first) cant launch any other source mod either, went to launch sdk base 2007… same error so deleted local content and reinstalling, will post if i get it working.

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: SanchoKobe
item.description:
Skitch:

https://support.steampowered.com/kb_article.php?ref=4595-WEXN-6831

Yep, did all that. I also redownloaded the torrent. Completely reinstalled my Steam client (saving the steamapps folder). Nothing works.

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: slimjim8094
item.description:
On that note, try verifying the md5sums. They should be in a file called BlackMesa.md5. If you downloaded a torrent, you should be good (since torrent files contain hashes of all the files, and are themselves hashed).

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: Mont_Blanc
item.description:
Did you download another copy of BM from a different server/torrent ? It can be a corrupted file.

Read full topic

item.title: This game is currently unavailable.
item.dc:creator: SanchoKobe
item.description:
readog:

I had the same problem. After a comp reboot the game worked.

I rebooted. Manually reinstalled Source SDK 2007, exited Steam, reinstalled BM, rebooted again, nope.

I installed Source SDK and Source SDK 2006, exited Steam, reinstalled BM, rebooted, nope.

I manually extracted the Blackmesa.7z to the sourcemods/BMS folder, rebooted again, nope.

“This game is currently unavailable. Please try again later.”

Read full topic
